entities.name: Siemens
entities.description: A global technology company known for its engineering and manufacturing capabilities.

entities.name: product development
entities.description: The process of creating and improving products.

entities.name: standardised package solution
entities.description: A pre-defined solution package developed for specific applications.

entities.name: project
entities.description: A planned set of interrelated tasks to achieve a specific goal.

entities.name: Product
entities.description: A product designed to fit varied markets with pre-engineered options.

entities.name: Manufacturing Time
entities.description: The time required to manufacture a product.

entities.name: Installation Time
entities.description: The time required to install a product.

entities.name: Maintenance Cost
entities.description: The cost associated with maintaining a product.

entities.name: Standard Documentation
entities.description: A set of documents that provide guidelines and information about the product.

entities.name: Package Purchase Cost
entities.description: The cost incurred when purchasing a package of products.

entities.name: acoustic package
entities.description: A technical package related to acoustics, specified for procurement.

entities.name: technical requirements
entities.description: Specifications that outline the necessary criteria for the procurement process.

entities.name: configurations
entities.description: Different setups or arrangements of the acoustic package.

entities.name: onshore application
entities.description: An application that is developed and operated within the home country or territory.

entities.name: offshore applications
entities.description: Applications that are developed and operated outside the home country or territory.

entities.name: specification
entities.description: A document detailing technical aspects and options for a package.

entities.name: supplier
entities.description: An entity that provides goods or services.

entities.name: supplier drawing numbers
entities.description: Specific identifiers for drawings provided by the supplier.

entities.name: supplier specific specification
entities.description: A detailed specification tailored to a specific supplier.

entities.name: bidder
entities.description: An individual or organization that submits a proposal or offer in response to a request for proposals.

entities.name: technical specification
entities.description: A detailed description of the technical requirements and standards that must be met.

entities.name: attachments
entities.description: Supplementary documents that provide additional information related to the technical specification.

entities.name: points of divergence
entities.description: Specific areas where the bidder's proposal may differ from the technical specification.

entities.name: component
entities.description: A part or element of a larger system or equipment.

entities.name: unit
entities.description: A distinct part of the equipment that can function independently.

entities.name: equipment of delivery
entities.description: The necessary tools and components required for delivery.

entities.name: scope of supply
entities.description: The range of items and services included in a delivery contract.

entities.name: complete and functional unit
entities.description: An assembly that is fully operational and ready for use.

entities.name: Acoustic Package
entities.description: A package defined by its acoustic performance rather than its design type.

entities.name: specification
entities.description: A detailed description of requirements or performance terms.

entities.name: performance terms
entities.description: Criteria used to define the functionality of the Acoustic Package.

entities.name: requirements
entities.description: Conditions that the Acoustic Package must meet.

entities.name: Main Scope of Supply
entities.description: The primary focus or range of products and services provided in a supply agreement.

entities.name: acoustic package
entities.description: A set of components or features related to sound or acoustics.

entities.name: scope
entities.description: The extent or range of the acoustic package's components and features.

entities.name: Acoustic enclosure
entities.description: A structure designed to reduce noise from machinery or equipment.

entities.name: Support steelwork
entities.description: Steel framework used to support structures or equipment.

entities.name: Ventilation system
entities.description: A system designed to provide fresh air and remove stale air from an environment.

entities.name: Fan
entities.description: A device that moves air to facilitate ventilation.

entities.name: Silencer
entities.description: A device used to reduce noise from exhaust or ventilation systems.

entities.name: Ventilation dampers
entities.description: Devices used to regulate airflow in ventilation systems.

entities.name: Filter
entities.description: A device that removes impurities from air or fluids.

entities.name: Duct work
entities.description: The system of ducts used to transport air in ventilation systems.

entities.name: Combustion intake system
entities.description: A system that supplies air for combustion processes.

entities.name: Exhaust system
entities.description: A system designed to expel gases produced by combustion.

entities.name: L.O cooler pipework
entities.description: Pipework used for lubricating oil cooling.

entities.name: Breather pipework
entities.description: Pipework that allows air to enter or exit a system to prevent vacuum or pressure buildup.

entities.name: Cable tray
entities.description: A support system for electrical cables.

entities.name: Small bore pipework
entities.description: Pipework with a small diameter used for various applications.

entities.name: supply
entities.description: The provision of goods or services to meet demand.

entities.name: General Split
entities.description: A term likely referring to the distribution or allocation of supply.

entities.name: Siemens
entities.description: A global technology company known for its engineering and manufacturing capabilities.

entities.name: combined test
entities.description: A testing methodology that involves multiple components or systems working together.

entities.description: A specific model of acoustic equipment.

entities.name: RU01042A
entities.description: Parameter drawing associated with the SGT-100-2S N package.

entities.name: acoustic equipment
entities.description: Equipment related to sound and acoustics.

entities.name: References
entities.description: Citations or sources of information used in a document.

entities.name: Design Codes
entities.description: Standards and guidelines used in the design process.

entities.name: International Standards
entities.description: Standards that are recognized globally for various industries.

entities.name: European Standards
entities.description: Standards that are recognized within Europe for various industries.

entities.name: supplier
entities.description: An entity that provides goods or services.

entities.name: design
entities.description: The process of creating a plan or drawing for the construction of an object or system.

entities.name: supplier
entities.description: An entity responsible for providing goods or services.

entities.name: standards
entities.description: Established norms or requirements for processes or products.

entities.name: local legislation
entities.description: Laws and regulations that are applicable in a specific locality.

entities.name: pre-definition
entities.description: The act of defining something in advance.

entities.name: implications
entities.description: The possible effects or consequences of an action.

relationships.description: Siemens is responsible for the development of product development processes.
The product development process leads to the creation of a standardised package solution.
The project aims to deliver a standardised package solution.
The product is structured to reduce manufacturing time and costs.
The product is designed to reduce installation time and cost.
The product structure is simplified to reduce maintenance costs.
The creation of a product necessitates a set of standard documentation.
The product aims to reduce package purchase costs.
The technical requirements specify the criteria for the acoustic package.
The acoustic package has two configurations.
The text contrasts onshore applications with offshore applications.
The specification refers to the supplier specific specification for detailed information.
The supplier provides drawing numbers that are relevant to the specification.
The bidder is required to adhere to the technical specification outlined in the document.
The technical specification includes attachments that provide further details.
The bidder must explicitly mention any deviations from the technical specification.
Components are essential parts of the equipment required for delivery.
Units are included in the equipment necessary for delivery.
The scope of supply must encompass all necessary equipment.
The equipment of delivery must create a complete and functional unit.
The Acoustic Package is defined by its specification in performance terms.
The specification is stated in performance terms rather than detailed descriptions.
The requirements cover the Acoustic Package.
The ventilation system includes fans as a component.
The ventilation system includes silencers to reduce noise.
The ventilation system includes dampers to regulate airflow.
The ventilation system may include filters for air purification.
The ventilation system utilizes duct work for air transport.
The combustion intake system includes filtration to ensure clean air supply.
The exhaust system includes silencers to minimize noise.
The exhaust system utilizes duct work for gas expulsion.
The exhaust system may include expansion joints where required.
L.O cooler pipework is related to breather pipework for system functionality.
Cable trays support small bore pipework above the enclosure roof.
Siemens works effectively when a combined test is required.
The SGT-100-2S N package is detailed in the RU01042A drawing.
The RU01042A drawing pertains to acoustic equipment parameters.
References often include design codes as part of the documentation.
The design must comply with International Standards.
The design must comply with European Standards.
The supplier is responsible for defining which standards are applicable.
The supplier develops standards to ensure compliance with local legislation.
Standards are adapted to suit local legislation when necessary.
The supplier considers pre-definition for adapting standards.
The pre-definition of standards has implications that need to be considered.
